com.tenforce.semtech.SPARQLParser.SPARQLStatements

Interface IStatement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AskBlock, BlockStatement, ConstructBlock, DescribeBlock, ParenthesesBlock, SelectBlock, SimpleStatement, UpdateBlockStatement, WhereBlockStatement

    public interface IStatement
    Created by langens-jonathan on 20.07.16. Interface to implement to be a statement. We expect the minimum for each statement is that a statement knows: - how to present itself as a string - which unknowns are inside it - what kind of statement it is

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IStatement.StatementType
      The types of statements we foresee.

    • Method Summary

      this will return the graph in which this statement belongs or null if it does not have a graph

      the types are describe in the StatementType definition

      void replaceGraphStatements(java.lang.String newGraph)
      this will propagate the replacement of ALL subsequent graph statements with the new graph name.
      void replaceGraphStatements(java.lang.String oldGraph, java.lang.String newGraph)
      this will propagate the replacement of ALL subsequent graph statements which are equal to the oldGraph's name.
      java.lang.String toString()

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing this block

      • getUnknowns

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getUnknowns()
        Returns:
        a set with the names of all unknowns in this block

      • getType

        IStatement.StatementType getType()
        the types are describe in the StatementType definition
        Returns:
        the type of block this is

      • clone

        IStatement clone()
        Returns:
        a clone of this object

      • replaceGraphStatements

        void replaceGraphStatements(java.lang.String newGraph)
        this will propagate the replacement of ALL subsequent graph statements with the new graph name. note that to remove all graph statements you can just pass an empty string as parameter
        Parameters:
        newGraph - the name of the new graph

      • replaceGraphStatements

        void replaceGraphStatements(java.lang.String oldGraph,
                            java.lang.String newGraph)
        this will propagate the replacement of ALL subsequent graph statements which are equal to the oldGraph's name. All graph statements targetting other graphs will remain untouched.
        Parameters:
        oldGraph - the name of tha graph that needs be replaced
        newGraph - the new graph name

      • getGraph

        java.lang.String getGraph()
        this will return the graph in which this statement belongs or null if it does not have a graph
        Returns:
        the graph on which this statement operates
